cellularAutomata.analysis
Class Analysis

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.analysis.Analysis
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener, java.util.Observer
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddYourOwnAnalysis, AllPopulationAnalysis, AverageValueAnalysis, BoxCountingDimensionAnalysis, CellTrackerAnalysis, ClusterAnalysis, CorrelationDimensionAnalysis, GeneticAlgorithmAnalysis, HammingDistanceAnalysis, LargestNeighborhoodAnalysis, MemoryUsageAnalysis, MusicAnalysis, NeighborhoodSizeAnalysis, PercentOccupiedAnalysis, PinCellValueAnalysis, PlotSliceValuesAnalysis, RandomAnalysis, ShowNeighborhoodAnalysis, SliceAnalysis, SpeedOfSimulationAnalysis, TargetValueAnalysis
public abstract class Analysis
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener

Analyzes cellular automaton data. For example, might calculate fractal dimension, or might calculate cycle length.

All child classes are loaded dynamically using reflection.

Code in the CA lattice warns the user/developer if a child of Analysis has been written without the required constructor (with properties as a parameter). This way the contract is enforced "nicely" by the CA code.

Note that this class follows the Observer design pattern. All Analysis classes are observers. The CAController is the observable class. Observers are attached to the observable with the CAController's startAnalysis() method, and removed with the stopAnalysis() method. The CAController notifies the observers by calling its analyzeData() method. Rather than an "update" method, the concrete subclasses of the Analysis class (observer classes) have an analyze() method.

Also note that the classic Observer pattern has been modified to include a Template Method pattern. The "update" method is actually replaced with a concrete analyzeData() method (the template method) that performs error checking. The subclasses of Analysis implement the abstract analyze() method that is called by analyzeData().

AND, this class also implements the Observer interface so that it can be informed of any changes in the AnalysisDrawingListener (the Observable).

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

Analysis

public Analysis(boolean minimalOrLazyInitialization)
Creates an analyzer for the CA data. By contract, all child classes must have a constructor with a single boolean parameter, similar to this constructor.

When building child classes, the minimalOrLazyInitialization parameter must be included but may be ignored. However, the boolean is intended to indicate when the child's constructor should build an analysis with as small a footprint as possible. In order to load analyses by reflection, the application must query the child classes for information like their display names, tooltip descriptions, etc. At these times it makes no sense to build the complete analysis which may have a large footprint in memory.

It is recommended that the child's constructor and instance variables do not initialize any variables and that variables be initialized only when first needed (lazy initialization). Or all initializations in the constructor may be placed in an if statement (as illustrated in the parent constructor and in most other analyses designed by David Bahr). 

 if(!minimalOrLazyInitialization)
 {
     ...initialize
 }

Parameters:
minimalOrLazyInitialization - When true, the constructor instantiates an object with as small a footprint as possible. When false, the analysis is fully constructed, complete with close buttons, display panels, etc. If uncertain, set this variable to false.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to add.

analyzeData

public boolean analyzeData(Lattice lattice,
                           Rule rule,
                           int generation)
Analyzes the cellular automaton data. This method is called once per generation, after the cells have been updated for that generation. Also called when the analysis is first started up.

Parameters:
lattice - The CA lattice.
rule - The CA rule.
generation - The current generation of the CA. There is no requirement that this be the generation analyzed, but typically, this will be the generation analyzed.
Returns:
true if successfully analyzed the data.

firePropertyChangeEvent

public void firePropertyChangeEvent(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent event)
Notify listeners of a property change.

Parameters:
event - Holds the changed property.

public javax.swing.JButton getCloseFrameButton()
Gets the button that is used to close the analysis.

Returns:
close button.

getCompatibleLattices

public abstract java.lang.String[] getCompatibleLattices()
A list of lattices with which this Analysis will work. In order for an analysis to display and be used, it must be compatible with both the lattice and the rule currently selected by a user (see getCompatibleRules).

Well-designed Analyses should work with any lattice, but some may require particular topological or geometrical information. Appropriate strings to return in the array include SquareLattice.DISPLAY_NAME, HexagonalLattice.DISPLAY_NAME, StandardOneDimensionalLattice.DISPLAY_NAME, etc. Return null if compatible with all lattices.

Returns:
A list of lattices compatible with this Analysis (returns the display names for the lattices). Returns null if compatible with all lattices.

getCompatibleRules

public abstract java.lang.String[] getCompatibleRules()
A list of Rules with which this Analysis will work. In order for an analysis to display and be used, it must be compatible with both the lattice and the rule currently selected by a user (see getCompatibleLattices).

Well-designed Analyses should work with any rule, but some may require particular rule-specific information. Appropriate strings to return in the array include the display names for any rule: for example, "Life", or "Majority Rules". These names can be accessed from the getDisplayName() method of each rule. For example, 

 new Life(super.getProperties()).getDisplayName()
Return null if compatible with all rules.

Returns:
A list of rules compatible with this Analysis (returns the display names for the rules). Returns null if compatible with all rules.

getDisplayFrame

public ShrinkingJFrame getDisplayFrame(java.awt.Dimension scrollViewSize)
Gets a JFrame that displays results and/or requests specific input information that the analysis needs to operate correctly. This frame will wrap the display inside of a scroll pane.

Parameters:
scrollViewSize - The dimensions of the scroll pane's view port. In other words, the size of the display area for the analysis.
Returns:
A display for the analysis results and/or for requesting specific input information that the analysis needs to operate correctly.

getDisplayPanelForTabbedPane

public javax.swing.JPanel getDisplayPanelForTabbedPane(java.awt.Dimension scrollViewSize)
Gets a JPanel that displays results and/or requests specific input information that the analysis needs to operate correctly. This panel is designed for display in a tabbed pane, and will wrap the display inside of a scroll pane.

Parameters:
scrollViewSize - The dimensions of the scroll pane's view port. In other words, the size of the display area for the analysis.
Returns:
A display for the analysis results and/or for requesting specific input information that the analysis needs to operate correctly.

getDisplayName

public abstract java.lang.String getDisplayName()
A very brief one or two-word string describing the analysis, appropriate for display as the title of a tabbed pane.

Returns:
A string no longer than 15 characters.

getLattice

public Lattice getLattice()
Get the CA lattice at the time analyze() was last called.

Returns:
The CA lattice. May be null if analyze() has never been called.

getPreferredScrollViewportSize

public java.awt.Dimension getPreferredScrollViewportSize()
Gets the size of the tab panel that holds the analysis. Developers may find this useful when laying out the display for their analyses.

Returns:
The dimension of the tab panel.

getRule

public Rule getRule()
Get the CA rule at the time analyze() was last called.

Returns:
The CA rule. May be null if analyze() has never been called.

getToolTipDescription

public abstract java.lang.String getToolTipDescription()
A brief description (written in HTML) that describes this analysis. The description will be displayed as a tooltip. Using html permits line breaks, font colors, etcetera, as described in HTML resources. Regular line breaks will not work.

Returns:
An HTML string describing this analysis.

isCompatibleAnalysis

public static boolean isCompatibleAnalysis(Analysis analysis)
Checks if the given analysis is compatible with the current CA lattice and rule.

Parameters:
analysis - The analysis being checked for compatibility.
Returns:
true if compatible.

propertyChange

public void propertyChange(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent event)
Override this method to handle the notification of any changes in properties. The default behavior is to do nothing.

Specified by:
propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener

refreshGraphics

public void refreshGraphics()
Refresh the graphics. Useful for example, if the analysis tags cells for different display. Note that the graphics will NOT update if the controls have been set to display graphics only at the end of a simulation (or if set to display every nth time step when this isn't the nth time step).

WARNING! This method is slow. It's best to only call this method when the CA is stopped and when it's not being called repeatedly. If using a mouse listener, it's far better to refresh the graphics using the technique shown in the comments in the update method (below).

removePropertyChangeListener

public void removePropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
Removes a change listener.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove.

rerunAnalysis

public boolean rerunAnalysis()
Reruns the analysis on the same data.

Returns:
tru if the analysis was rerun successfully.

restrictDisplayWidthToVisibleSpace

public abstract boolean restrictDisplayWidthToVisibleSpace()
If returns true, then the analysis is forced to size its width to fit within the visible width of the tabbed pane where it is displayed. If false, then a horizontal scroll bar is added so that the analysis can be wider than the displayed space.

Recommend returning true. If your graphics look lousy within that space, then return false. (In other words, try both and see which is better.)

Returns:
true if the graphics should be forced to size its width to fit the display area.

reset

public abstract void reset()
Performs any necessary functions to reset the analysis to its original state without restarting the analysis. This method will be called when a new CA simulation is started by the user.

resizeActions

public void resizeActions(java.awt.event.ComponentEvent e)
May be overriden by child classes that want to take some action when the analysis frame is resized. This is called when the JFrame holding the analysis is resized.

By default, this method does nothing. Child classes (analyses) may override if desired. For example, the SliceAnalysis overrides this method.

This method is called automatically when the analysis frame is resized and when it is converted between a tab and a pane. It is not recommended that this method be called directly.

Parameters:
e - The event that triggered this action. May be null.

shouldSuspendMouseDrawing

public boolean shouldSuspendMouseDrawing()
Override this method if the analysis wants to suspend regular mouse drawing behavior (the drawing and erasing of cells on the CA lattice). Sometimes, drawing events might interfere with an analysis. Sometimes regular mouse drawing might interfere with special drawing that is done by this analysis.

This method is only queried once when the analysis first starts. Therefore, changing the value while the analysis is running will have no effect.

Returns:
false by default.

stop

public void stop()
Performs any necessary operations to stop the analysis. Developers should implement the abstract method stopAnalysis() rather than overriding this method.

stop

public void stop(java.awt.Point p)
Performs any necessary operations to stop the analysis and then, if the analysis is displayed in a frame, this shrinks the frame to the specified point. Developers should implement the abstract method stopAnalysis() rather than overriding this method.

Parameters:
p - The point in space to which the frame will be shrunk. May be null.

update

public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
This method handles mouse "drawing" events on the CA graphics (drawn on the Lattice). This method is automatically called by the AnalysisDrawingListener class (an Observable class which listens to mouse events).

This method is required as part of the Observer design pattern. The Analysis class is the Observer which watches the Observable AnalysisDrawingListener.

Developers that wish to take actions based on mouse drawing events should override the handleMouseEvents() method.

Specified by:
update in interface java.util.Observer
Parameters:
o - The observable (AnalysisDrawingListener) class that called this method.
arg - The MouseState that existed when a mouse event forced this method to be automatically called.
